question_text: A technician is troubleshooting a system that emits a continuous short beep on power-up and displays no video. No POST screen appears. Which of the following is the most likely root cause?
answer_options: The BIOS boot sequence is misconfigured
The CPU is not seated properly or has failed
correct_answer: The CPU is not seated properly or has failed
explanation: Continuous beep codes often indicate CPU-related issues. A misaligned or failed CPU can prevent POST from initializing any video output.
